list_definition.mean_english: thuộc hoặc sử dụng kỹ thuật sinh học

list_ex_of_english: When he was introduced, he experienced symptoms suggesting bionic rejection and was due to be dissected.
The most important project in these laboratories is a bionic hand for people to have an upper limb amputee.
Many devices have been developed, usually modeled on the cochlear implant or bionic ear devices, a type of neural prosthesis in use since the mid-1980s.
A recent area of research is in the field of bionic lenses.
The bionic arm is used to climb up to higher platforms, swing across chasms, and pick up some items.
She also had a bionic ear which allowed her to hear at low volumes, at different frequencies than most humans, and over uncommonly long distances.
Had she been a regular, non-bionic field agent, her mental issues would have disqualified her from being an agent.
We have the capability to make the world's first bionic man.
